text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with more stuffed peppers i know we
did him already but we did these and
they were okay but they weren't great we
rework the recipe and now we're using
green and now we're using halfs and much
better so i posted the written recipe
here's the video that goes with it
okay so this starts with 1 diced onion
we're going to sweat that in a little
bit of olive oil with a pinch of salt
when it's translucent about 5-6 minutes
take out half and save half for the
stuffing leave the other half in the pan
this is going to be our braising liquid
or our sauce a little bit of balsamic
vinegar beef stock marinara sauce pinch
of red pepper flakes or cayenne give it
a stir pour that into the bottom of a
deep large casserole dish and set it
aside or as they say in the cookbook biz
reserved until needed all right there's
our other half of the onions I'm going
to add ground beef and a little change
of the recipe we're putting some sausage
in and by the way in case you're
wondering no I haven't started getting
manicures those hands are attached to
the lovely and talented Michelle my wife
we got garlic we got parsley we got salt
black pepper of course look I am because
I like it and a can of diced tomato I'm
using a petite diced that's French for
slightly more expensive alright we're
going to mix that up use your hands much
easier at least for that part once
that's mixed in make sure you got a nice
paste with that tomato and that beef
that's going to give it a beautiful nice
tender texture then we're going to add
our cooked rice and our parmesan when
that's mixed together you're ready to
stuff like I said this time we're using
green peppers for a little extra
bitterness instead of the red we're also
going to use 1/2 instead of a whole make
sure when you cut them you got the flat
side so they sit nice in the pan so cut
those directly in half scoop out the
seeds membranes etc stuff them very
firmly with your stuffing and then mount
it up you should have just a perfect
amount of stuffing for 8 halves ok so
those go in the baking dish on top of
the sauce I'm going to give it just a
little more parmesan on top just a
little sprinkling cover it with foil put
it in a 375-degree oven for 45 minutes
but it's not done at that point take off
the foil and give it another 15 20 25
minutes whatever we're going to reduce
that liquid a little bit the tops going
to get a little color they're done when
the peppers tender and that's it spoon
over some of that hot oniony delicious
amazing sauce just a great American
comfort classic by the way give a try
with the green pepper I know you may
think red sweeter better give it a try
with the green I think the bitterness
really works in us anyway now you got
the video that goes along with the new
written recipe go the site all the
ingredients are there and as always
enjoy
